name: ionice
description: set or get process I/O scheduling class and priority

options.description: name or number of scheduling class,  0: none, 1: realtime, 2: best-effort, 3: idle
priority (0..7) in the specified scheduling class, only for the realtime and best-effort classes
act on these already running processes
act on already running processes in these groups
act on already running processes owned by these users

tldr:
> Get or set program I/O scheduling class and priority.
> Scheduling classes: 1 (realtime), 2 (best-effort), 3 (idle).
> Priority levels: 0 (the highest) - 7 (the lowest).
> More information: <https://manned.org/ionice>.

- Set I/O scheduling class of a running process:

`ionice -c {{scheduling_class}} -p {{pid}}`

- Run a command with custom I/O scheduling class and priority:

`ionice -c {{scheduling_class}} -n {{priority}} {{command}}`

- Print the I/O scheduling class and priority of a running process:

`ionice -p {{pid}}`
